<article id="2022-11-17">
<strong>2022-11-17</strong>

The Journées du Centre SÈVE 2022 were the proof of Centre SÈVE's interest in promoting the cooperation and partnership with international researchers. During the *Réunion Conjointe Centre SÈVE-[SFR NorVége](https://fed4277.wixsite.com/sfrnormandievegetal)* (France), professors from Quebec (Université de Sherbrooke, Agriculture and Agrifood Canada, Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières, Université Laval and McGill University) presented their work beside researchers from France universities (UniLaSalle-Rouen, Université de Caen Normandie and  Université de Rouen Normandie). Also, the networking hour brought to the students the possibility to participate at the Summer Schools in Morocco (2023) and Cameroun (2024).

At the _Student Symposium_, 24 students presented their master's and doctorate projects in the sessions: (A) Microbial interactions and resistance, (B) Plant sciences, (C) Agriculture productions and environment. Congratulations to winners of best presentation!

**_Session A: Microbial interactions and resistance_**<br>
**First place**: Maude Pomerleau (Université de Sherbrooke)<br>
**Second place**: Rosaelle Perreault (Université de Sherbrooke)



**_Session B: Plant sciences_**<br>
**First place**: Souleimen Jmii (Université du Québec à Montréal)<br>
**Second place**: [Ingrid Berenice Sanchez Carrillo] (Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières)


**_Session C: Agriculture productions and environment_**<br>
**First place**: Jessica Nicksy (McGill University)<br>
**Second place**: Felix L'Heureux Bilodeau (Université Laval)


See the photos taken during this incredible scientific meeting at [Centre SÈVE's social media](https://www.facebook.com/centreseve).

<br><br>
</article>

<article id="2022-09-07">
<strong>2022-09-07</strong>

Congratulations to Dr. Andrew Diamond, who just finished his PhD in Cellular and Molecular Biology under the direction of Dr. Isabel Desgagné-Penix and Dr. Simon Barbabé at the UQTR. And again congratulations for having his article published the day before his thesis defense. Bravo!

We wish you all the best in your future endeavors!

Publication: [Is there a spice missing in the recipe? The intra-cellular localization of vanillin biosynthesis needs more investigations](https://doi.org/10.1111/plb.13465)
</article>

<br><br>

<article id="2022-09-05">
<strong>2022-09-05</strong>

Many congratulations to our ex-President [Claire Letanneur] for starting a postdoctorate position at [Ulysse Biotech](https://ulysse-biotech.com/).

We also congratulate [Amal Jaballi](https://www.linkedin.com/in/amal-jaballi-b2992a1b1/) for finishing her Master's with Dr. [Tagnon Missihoun] and Dr. [Seydou Ka], previous PhD student in the lab of Dr. Isabel Desgagné-Penix, for being promoted to Analyst and Researcher at [CCrest laboratories](http://ccrestlab.com/).

We wish you all the best in your future endeavors!

<br><br>


<article id="2022-08-31">

Congratulations Dr. Isabel Desgagné-Penix's research group from the UQTR, specially Marie-Pierre Girard and Vahid Karimzadegan, for the publication in the journal [Molecules](https://www.mdpi.com/journal/molecules).

Congratulations Dr. Isabel Desgagné-Penix's research group from the UQTR (Manoj Koirala, Vahid Karimzadegan, Nuwan Sameera Liyanage et Natacha Mérindol) for the publication in the journal [Biomolecules](https://www.mdpi.com/journal/biomolecules).

<article id="2022-04-7">
<strong>2022-04-7</strong>

The international collaboration of Dr. Isabel Desgagné-Penix's research group (Dr. Natacha Mérindol et Marie-Pierre Girard), Dr. Lionel Berthoux (UQTR) and the _Dipartimento di Biologie_ of the <em>Università di Napoli Federico II</em>, Italy, resulted in a publication showing the medicinal properties of alkaloids from teh plant _Pancratium maritimum_. Bravo!

Publication: [Cytotoxicity and Antiviral Properties of Alkaloids Isolated from Pancratium maritimum](https://doi.org/10.3390/toxins14040262)
</article>

<br><br>

<article id="2022-04-12">
<strong>2022-04-12</strong>

Congratulations to our Centre SÈVE member Dr. [Hugo Germain] and his team members [Théo Devèze], [Claire Letanneur], [Nikunj Sharma] and [Snehi Gazal] for having a successful Indian expedition on the biodiversity of _Cannabis_ in the fall 2021! 

Their work has been published in [NEO UQTR](https://neo.uqtr.ca/2022/03/30/expedition-scientifique-en-inde-etudier-la-biodiversite-du-cannabis/?fbclid=IwAR3jYGNy2PgEz1I_JzIjh6sePDGWw1PQgAH9UWvJ7vo1onOkwfdZLhSUcp4).

Read about their journey and scientific work carried out in India with mesmerizing images of Himalayan ranges with _Cannabis_. 

<br><br>
</article>
